so there's a plan for
them to deliver on it?

1052.66.text:
think our study planner is
pretty structured as it is.

1055.02.text:
Although, if you look
on the module website,

1056.85.text:
we tell students what we
expect them to do in each week

1059.31.text:
and what the resources
are for each week.

1062.25.text: So, to really go through these.

1064.29.text:
And I think, in some ways, yes,
if you focus on assessment,

1069.73.text: But that's not all to a module.

1071.03.text:
I think it's also about
reading around and reading

1073.71.text:
the subjects that are
not necessarily assessed.

1076.68.text:
But, when it comes
to assessment,

1078.13.text:
I mean, let's say
we're finishing now

1080.04.text:
before the Christmas
break, and then

1086.01.text:
Really think about, have a
look at what the assignment is.

1089.26.text:
[LAUGH] Have a really
good look at it.

1091.32.text:
Have a look at that we've
got two-part assignment.

1095.42.text:
And really look at what
the two different parts are

1097.80.text: and what you need to focus on.

1101.73.text:
Have a think about what kind
of skills are required there.

1104.48.text:
And really have a
really good look

1106.32.text:
at the guidance notes
in the assignment book,

1108.42.text:
as well, to tell
you what's expected.

1114.72.text:
And also be aware that,
obviously, over Christmas,

1121.44.text:
it's really set-- if
you have questions,

1125.75.text:
KAREN FOLEY: Well, I'm going
to ask Matt all about that,

1128.50.text:
And just before I finish, are
there any burning questions?

1130.92.text:
Because I want to ask
Stefanie something, as well.

1133.23.text:
So, are there any
burning questions

1135.65.text:
HJ: I think we've gotten loads
of good stuff from the session.

1138.23.text:
People say they've got
loads of stuff to do.

1140.61.text:
And some of the things
that we want to know-- we

1143.67.text:
got a few questions, so maybe
we could quickly tackle them.

1147.57.text:
Richard would like tips for
finding suitable study buddies.

1152.08.text:
Sarah finds it
difficult to plan,

1154.23.text:
with other commitments--
work, family, night life,

1157.17.text:
and chronic illness, which
can be a barrier to returning

1161.58.text:
And a question
about being nervous,

1168.09.text: How to deal with that, as well.

1169.90.text:
So, what do we think
about those points?

1171.93.text:
KAREN FOLEY: Well, we'll leave
the TMA feedback for Matt,

1173.64.text:
because I'm going to talk to
him a lot about all of that.

1176.26.text:
But what are some
of your thoughts

1180.18.text:
STEFANIE SINCLAIR: There were
a number of different things.

1183.53.text:
In terms of finding
a study buddy,

1184.95.text:
I think that's a really good
idea, if you can do this.

1190.98.text:
The easiest way is to come
to a face-to-face tutorial

1195.75.text:
And, in my experience,
I have tutored, as well,

1198.90.text:
And you have groups
of people who've

1202.47.text:
followed each other,
throughout several modules.

1205.41.text:
And that always seems
to work very nicely.

1207.21.text:
If you're lucky enough to
find someone like-minded.

1209.79.text:
Obviously, you're not allowed
to copy from each other.

1212.04.text:
But it's really helpful to
have someone else to chat--

1214.54.text:
KAREN FOLEY: But would you be
able to, say, put on your tutor

1220.53.text:
KAREN FOLEY: Could
people put that out?

1222.16.text:
if you can come to a
face-to-face event,

1224.26.text:
or if you want to reach
people who can't go there,

1227.12.text:
because there's many
others out there,

1228.70.text:
go perhaps do a
tutor group forum.

1231.35.text:
It might also be
worth approaching

1233.35.text:
your tutor who can help you
get in touch with other people.

1237.19.text:
Because the problem
is that, obviously,

1240.20.text:
sharing out addresses is
perhaps a bit of an issue.

1243.33.text:
But the tutor group forum is
a really good starting point,

1249.10.text:
To say hey, I'm
looking for someone.

1252.67.text:
And they're likely to be
near you, as well, if they're

1258.73.text:
So, there's loads of
ways you can do things.

1260.14.text: Get in touch with your tutor.

1261.64.text:
Post a note on the
tutor group forum

1264.62.text:
But ultimately it doesn't have
to be a formal thing, does it?

1266.65.text:
You can just hook up with
someone-- be on the phone.

1268.69.text:
You can be on the phone
once, or every week.

1270.61.text:
It doesn't need to
be something set up.

1272.27.text:
You can just meet other
students and maybe even

1275.47.text:
at the Student
Hub Live, as well.

1277.08.text:
Although we can't give
emails on the chat.

1278.83.text:
But we do have a forum, and
we do have an email address,

1282.58.text:
so you can always
drop us an email.

1284.74.text:
If you'd like to
study with somebody,

1286.45.text:
let us know which
module you're with.

1288.23.text:
And we can see if there are any
other students who would also

1290.77.text: like to study with you, too.

1291.89.text:
STEFANIE SINCLAIR: And
it's really quite useful,

1293.65.text:
I mean, there might
be the odd person

1295.36.text:
who's kind of-- there might
be some people who are, like,

1299.69.text:
[LAUGH] But I think
what's much more common

1302.86.text:
is, you find someone
else who's going, like,

1304.69.text: oh, I have so much to do!

1306.17.text: How am I going to cope?

1307.13.text:
And you'll see that others
are in very similar situations

1310.30.text:
and deal with very
similar issues.

1312.52.text:
I think that's really,
really useful to know.

1314.89.text:
I mean, I find it
helpful, because--

1316.62.text:
to realise that you're
not on your own,

1322.48.text:
That's all we've got time
for in this short session.

1324.46.text:
As usual with every
time-management session,

1327.29.text:
But thank you for
bringing all your advice

1329.71.text:
and for giving us a
space to talk about this.

1331.93.text:
And if you'd like to see
some of the resources

1333.85.text:
that Stefanie's
put on the website,

1335.38.text:
we've got the AA100 planner on
there, a section of it which

1339.12.text:
gives you some really good ideas
about breaking things down,

1341.62.text:
in terms of weekly
tasks, et cetera.

1344.04.text:
And I'm sure we'll keep
this conversation going

1346.89.text:
So, Stefanie, thank you very
much for joining me today.

1350.48.text:
Before we get Matt on, to
talk about all of these issues

1352.84.text:
around feedback and when TMAs
are getting more difficult,

1355.55.text:
I'd like to see, Sophie
and HJ, whether there

1357.42.text:
were any other tips and things
that people have come up with,

1359.96.text:
in terms of how to manage their
time over the Christmas break.

1362.76.text:
SOPHIE: Yes, there's been some
really good ones, actually.

1367.21.text:
And he goes on to say he's
heard about a general rule.

1370.96.text:
And you commit to the
first three minutes.

1374.00.text:
And after three minutes, if
you still aren't ready for it,

1377.58.text:
But generally the first three
minutes gets you into it,

1379.87.text: and then you keep on going.

1381.72.text:
And he's applied
that to his studies.

1383.48.text:
And he's actually upped
it to five minutes.

1385.27.text:
So he'll do five minutes--
when he's really not

1387.40.text:
feeling like studying, really
just wants to lie in bed, does

1391.93.text:
And then, after that, if
he's still not up for it,

1396.04.text:
But then it hopefully
gets him into the swing

1398.62.text:
of things, which is a
really good idea, actually.

1402.08.text: So, thank you very much, Ben.

1403.29.text:
HJ: And we got some
nice chat leading

1407.17.text:
a lot of people are refreshing
their computers, over and over

1412.37.text:
And we're talking about some of
the harder TMAs that come up.

1416.77.text:
And how talking to tutors, and
how we can break them down.

1421.27.text:
So this session will
definitely be-- everyone's

1425.32.text:
And hopefully we'll
get loads of questions

1435.15.text: What are you eating, at home?

1437.03.text:
It's around lunchtime,
now, so I expect everyone's

1439.81.text: having a few bits to eat.

1441.11.text:
These mince pies are going
down very well, I can tell you,

1443.53.text:
and so is the mulled
wine, which is nice.

1445.45.text:
But we're only allowed
very small glasses,

1447.20.text:
for those of us who
